p: The smooth SSD avoids overestimation of the misfit due to a discretization effect, whereas a naive empirical SSD as in [ 8] can be shown to be biased. As the numerical experiments in the S1 File illustrate, the empirical SSD can provide a biased and misleading snapshot of conformance to Benfordâ€™s Law (see Fig 4, S1 File). For the GTC dataset, the empirical SSD (not reported) would be generally well above the smooth SSD curve from Fig 4, especially in the years where the number of cyclones was lower.
